document.docAuthor: Gusarov, Vladimir I. & Koval, Alexander G.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Heinzia Korge, 1971 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Quediina), with description of a new species and its probable larva

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Heinzia Korge, 1971 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Quediina), with description of a new species and its probable larva

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heinzia
is most closely related to
Strouhalium
Scheerpeltz, 1962
and
Beeria
Hatch, 1957
(
Korge 1971
; Smetana 1977 , 1995 ).

Heinzia
differs from
Beeria
in having prothoracic hypomera invisible in lateral view, numerous punctures in lateral portions of pronotum, protarsi equally dilated in both sexes, entire paramere, and modified female abdominal tergum 10 .

Heinzia
differs from
Strouhalium
in having glabrous segments of labial palpus (
Smetana 1995
) and modified female abdominal tergum 10 .
Description. Length 8.5­11.5 mm . Body from brownish black to black, legs brown with lighter tarsi and black inner surface of tibia, mouthparts and bases of antennal segments brown to brownish red.

Type species.
Heinzia variabilis
Korge, 1971
, by original designation.
